intro: Cyrtandra grayana var. lanaiensis, commonly known as the Lanai cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. This species is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique adaptations to its island habitat.
